codeSystems.name: SNOMED_CT
codeSystems.title: SNOMED CT (all versions)
codeSystems.description: SNOMED CT is the most comprehensive and precise clinical health terminology product in the world, owned and distributed around the world by The International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO).
codeSystems.http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-referenc: Observation Reference Range Applies To Codes

codeSystems.name: PHOccupationalDataForHealthODH
codeSystems.title: Occupational Data for Health (ODH)
codeSystems.description: The concepts representing the values supporting Occupational Data for Health, including Job Supervisory Level or Pay Grade (ODH) code system consists of data elements that describe a person's work information, structured to facilitate individual, population, and public health use; not intended to support billing.).
codeSystems.https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewValueS: Job Supervisory Level or Pay Grade (ODH)

codeSystems.name: ObservationReferenceRangeMeaningCodes
codeSystems.title: Observation Reference Range Meaning Codes
codeSystems.description: This value set defines a set of codes that can be used to indicate the meaning/use of a reference range for a particular target population.

codeSystems.name: ObservationValue
codeSystems.title: ObservationValue
codeSystems.description: This code system covers all concepts of HL7-defined values for the Observation value element, when it has a coded datatype.

codeSystems.name: WorkClassificationODH
codeSystems.title: Work Classification (Occupational Data for Health)
codeSystems.description: Code system of concepts representing a person's job type as defined by compensation and sector (e.g. paid vs. unpaid, self-employed vs. not self-employed, government vs. private, etc.).

codeSystems.name: InternationalClassificationOfOccupations2008
codeSystems.title: International Classification Of Occupations 2008
codeSystems.description:
The International Classification of Occupations (ISCO) seeks to facilitate international communication about occupations by providing statisticians with a framework to make internationally comparable occupational data available, and by allowing international occupational data to be produced in a form that can be useful for research as well as for specific decision-making and action-oriented activities.
The current version, known as ISCO-08, was published in 2008 and is the fourth iteration, following ISCO-58, ISCO-68 and ISCO-88.
Published by IHE with authority from the International Labor Organization Given on July 18th 2024. This code system will be removed if and when a more formal publication is taken on by this organization.
